summary: Without sufficient investment, transit agencies' buses, rail cars, and other capital assets can become increasingly unreliable and hard to maintain. The Federal Transit Administration provides financial and technical assistance to help agencies manage assets. Transit agencies that receive federal funds also must participate in FTA's Transit Asset Management program, which requires them to inventory assets, assess their condition, prioritize a list of investments, and more...
title: Transit Asset Management: FTA Should Clarify Performance Data and Develop a Plan to Guide Future Program Improvements
